arm_group.description: Patients enrolled in this arm will undergo corrective surgery of the distal radius, with pre-operative computer-assisted planning and virtual osteotomy.
Patients in this group will undergo corrective osteotomy of the distal radius wit conventional pre-operative planning.

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators are comparing post-operative patient-rated functional outcome between
      patients who undergo corrective osteotomy for extra-articular malunited distal radius
      fractures with and without computer assisted pre-operative planning and virtual osteotomy.

clinical_study.brief_title: Computer Assisted Planning of Corrective Osteotomy for Distal Radius Malunion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Adult (over 18 yrs of age)

          -  Extra-articular malunion of the distal radius

          -  Fluent in English

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant patients

          -  prisoners

          -  patients with impaired decision making ability

          -  patients with a bony deformity in the distal forearm contralateral to the one with
             distal radius malunion

intervention.description: The corrective osteotomy will be planned with computer-assisted pre-operative planning and virtual osteotomy.
intervention.intervention_name: Corrective osteotomy with computer-assisted pre-operative planning

intervention.description: The corrective osteotomy will be planned with conventional preoperative planning.
intervention.intervention_name: Corrective osteotomy with conventional preoperative planning

facility.name: Christine M. Kleinert Institute of Hand and Microsurgery

clinical_study.official_title: Computer Assisted Planning of Corrective Osteotomy for Distal Radius Malunion

overall_official.affiliation: Christine M. Kleinert Institute of Hand and Microsurgery

primary_outcome.description: Grip strength as compared to the normal, contralateral hand is considered the most important outcome measure for patients with distal radius fractures.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
